custom.name: factbox
custom.custom:title: Content from Grenland
custom.paragraph: The content in this eZ Publish release is provided by VisitGrenland.

custom.name: quote
custom.custom:author: Henrik Ibsen
custom.paragraph: community is like a ship; everyone ought be prepared to take the helm.

section.paragraph: Langesund fjord
Brevik bridge
Langesund lighthouse
Sunset at Langesund
The Grenland region comprises four municipalities: Skien, Porsgrunn, Bamble, and Siljan. Skien Grenland is the hometown of the eZ Systems headquarters.

The development of Skien started a thousand years ago where the waterway from the mountains of Telemark met the waterway from the sea. As one of the oldest towns in Norway and as the county capital, Skien presents itself as at thriving culture a service town with nearly 50,000 inhabitants. The waterfront is an important element in the townscape, in addition to the mixture of charming pedestrian areas, green areas and monumental buildings. Skien is Henrik Ibsen`s birthplace, and the foundation for his world famous authorship was laid in this town. Several locks are to be found in Skien at the start of the Telemark Canal – the first of which is in the heart of town!

Porsgrunn grew from being a coastal town serving Skien in the 1650s to what it is today. Its existence is due to a favourable position and a good harbour. The district has an archipelago, forest, lakes and farmland areas. The population of the district is 32,000. Osebakken, a part of the town on the east side next to the river, was once the home of affluent ships masters. It is well preserved and well worth strolling around.

Brevik is a vital port of shipment for timbre and ice and is located in picturesque surroundings on the tip of Eidanger peninsula. Many of the original wooden buildings have been preserved. The Brevik coast is lined with magnificent skerries. In summer, Brevik offers boat excursions along the Sherries and walks through historical town sites with " the old watchman".

The district of Siljan lies immediately to the east of Skien with a population of about 2.300. It is a community based upon agriculture and forestry. The Siljanelva River runs through the valley, creating large and small pools well stocked with fish. The attractive and varied scenery has made Siljan a popular excursion area for the Grenland region.
Ibsen Hat
Die Grenland Region umfasst vier Ortschaften: Skien, Porsgrunn, Bamble und Siljan. In Skien liegt die Heimat der eZ Systems Zentrale.

paragraph.line: Wo das Wasser aus den Telemarksbergen sich mit dem Meerwasser des Fjordes vereint, wurde die Stadt gegründet.

Das heitere Kultur- und Servicestädtchen gehört zu den ältesten Norwegens, ist die Hauptstadt des Bezirks und zählt fast 50.000 Einwohner. Charakteristisch ist das dem Hafen zugewandte Stadtbild, eine bunte Mischung aus Fußgängerzone, Grünanlagen und eindrucksvollen Bauwerken. Skien ist die Geburtsstadt Henrik Ibsens. Sie bildet die Grundlage seiner weltberühmten Dichtung. Wer will, findet hier natürlich interessante Erinnerungsstücke und Zeugnisse vom Leben und Werk des Künstlers. Mehrere Schleusen des Telemarkskanals befinden sich im Bereich der Gemeinde Skien, eine sogar mitten in der Stadt!

section.paragraph: Porsgrunn, um 1650 südlich von Skien gegrûndet, hat sich zu einem lebhaften Kûstenort entwickelt. Der Ort verdankt seine Existenz der günstigen Lage und seinen guten Hafenbedingungen. Die Gemeinde ist nicht nur reich an Schären, Wäldern, Flüssen, Seen und landwirtschaftlichen Flächen, sondern auch stark urbanisiert. Insgesamt hat die Gemeinde ca. 32.000 Einwohner. Besonders sehenswert ist Osebakken im östlichen Teil der Stadt.

Das idyllische Städtchen Brevik wurde 1964 in Porsgrunn eingemeindet. Es kann auf alte Tradition als Exporthafen für Eisblöcke und Holz zurückblicken. Alte, gepflegte Häuser zeugen noch regelmäßig Fähren nach den Inseln im Eidangerfjord wo Badeplätze und Campingplätze warten.

Der naturschöne Ort östlich von Skien hat 2.300 Einwohner. Durch die Land- und Forstgemeinde fließ die Siljanelva, die größere und kleinere Seen bildet und zahlreiche Bade- Und Paddelmöglichkeiten bieten. Sportanglern stehen mehr als 80 Seen zur Verfüng. Wegen seiner abwechslungsreichen Landschaft in Siljan ein beliebtes Ausflugsgebiet.
Ibsen Hat
Grenland består av fire kommuner; Skien, Porsgrunn, Bamble og Siljan. Skien er hjembyen til eZ Systems hovedkontor.

Det er vannveien fra Telemarksfjellene i møte med vannveien fra havet som skapte Skien for tusen år siden. I 2000 feiret Skien sitt 1000 års jubileum. Som en av de eldste byene i Norge og som fylkeshovedstad fremstår Skien som en trivelig kultur- og serviceby med ca 50 000 innbyggere. Selve vannfronten er en viktig del av bybildet, som forøvrig er en blanding av gågater, grønne lunger og monumentale bygninger. Skien er Henrik Ibsens fødeby, og grunnlaget for hans verdensberømte forfatterskap ble lagt her i byen. Interessante minner og virke finner du selvsagt i Skien. De to første slusene i Telemarkskanalen ligger i Skien kommune, den første er til og med midt i Skien Sentrum.

Navnet stammer fra den lille buskplanten Pors, som vokste langs elven gjennom byen. Havnen utviklet seg ved utskipning av trelast p† 1600-tallet. Industrialiseringen skjøt fart på 1800-tallet med skipsbyggerier og sagbruksvirksomhet. Byen har variert industri og næringsliv, allsidig kulturliv og trivelig handelsmiljø. Porsgrunn har ca.32000 innbyggere. Kommunen har en variert skjærgård med mange godt tilrettelagte friarealer. I Porsgrunn er det kort avstand til skog, fjell og kystområder.

Var tidligere en betydelig utskipshavn for trelast og is. Den har en vakker beliggenhet ytterst p† Eidanger-halvøya, og mye av den opprinnelige trehusbebyggelsen er bevart. Utenfor Brevik ligger en fantastisk flott skjærgård. Om sommeren byr Brevik på sightseeingturer med båt i skjærgården, rusleturer med den gamle "vægter", historiske rusleturer i byens gater og safari i Norcem gruver.

Siljan kommune ligger umiddelbart øst for Skien og har ca. 2300 innbyggere. Det er en jord- og skogbrukskommune, der ca 90% av skogen eies av Treschow-Fritz›e, Larvik. Gjennom bygda renner Siljanelva, som stadig danner små og store vann, rike p† fisk. Den fine og varierte naturen har gjort Siljan til et viktig utfartsområde for Grenlandsregionen og det arbeides fortløpende med tilrettelegging av naturområdene.
Ibsens hatt
Mule Varde is publicly owned, and the magnificent gardens are now open to the public after extensive restoration. The gardens are open all year and are beautifully situated by the Eidangerfjord.

paragraph.line: The beautiful manor house and park we see today date back to when the shipowner Petersen bought the site in 1874 and began large-scale building work. The manor house now functions as a community centre, and the outdoor areas are equipped with excellent paths and beautiful lawns as in the good old days.
The small summerhouse and beaches combine to provide attractive bathing facilities.

The tourist office for Porsgrunn and the surrounding areas has set out a nature trail called the “Mule Walk”, a circular walk around the local area. Use the path, but leave the natural areas untouched.

section.paragraph: What about a trip to stunning Steinvika in Langesund on a beautiful summer’s day or even when it’s wet and windy? Park at the market place in the town centre and follow the signs; parking is also available in Steinvika. Here you will find rocks worn smooth over time and fantastic bathing opportunities for all the family. But what could be better than seeing the southwest wind sweep into the Rognsfjord, the waves crash against the cliffs and the spray shoot up into the air? Many people find this simply stunning. To enjoy the spectacle of Steinvika on a stormy day, it’s important to wear suitable clothing.

Tempted by Bamble’s highest peak? Then take a trip to Hørsfjell, from where you can see large expanses of the Telemark coast. The rolling Bamble countryside dominates to the west and north. The prevailing species of tree is pine, with lots of old, crooked, intertwined and bewitching trees. The easiest way to the top is via the logging road from Heistad in the village of Bamble (parking available at Lake Bamble). From the end of the logging road, a path leads up to the summit at 288 m above sea level.

The cultural trail leads through an area of the town steeped in history. The trail starts and finishes at Århus farm in Århus. Attractions en route include the Carp Dam at Århus farm, Cudrios Venstøp, burial mounds, Ibsens Venstøp (the playwright’s childhood home), rock carvings and Fossum, home to the former ironworks. Skien Historical Society has produced a guidebook to the area, which is available from the tourist office in Skien. Richly illustrated infoboards providing informative text have been set up along the trail.

This is a culture-historical trail comprising six infoboards which use text and images to illustrate historical figures and events associated with the locations. The trail leads through easy terrain on pavements/ footpaths.

This path is at Skotfoss and comprises a 3.7 km-long cultural trail starting at Løveid, which, incidentally, is part of the Telemark Canal. The path continues into picturesque forest areas and along the watercourse. 12 boards along the route provide historical information. A dedicated brochure is available at the tourist office in Skien.

It’s well worth taking a stroll around and by “Brevik’s Dams”, an enticing area for a walk in picturesque surroundings - fantastic for families with children. A dedicated map of the Frierfjord is available from tourist offices in Grenland. Follow the path to the Viewpoint, which offers an awe-inspiring view out into the entrance to the Frierfjord and all the islands. Another path continues from the Dams to Prekestolen [The Pulpit] and Ole Høyland’s Cave, the hideout of the 19th-century outlaw. You need to watch your step here, as the precipitous main slope plunges into the sea. From here you can see most of the Frierfjord and the industrial plant of the Statoil and Hydro Rafnes sites.
Swimming

There are plenty of opportunities for fishing in the Grenland fjords. Langesund Bay is also renowned for deep-sea fishing, with many records being set during the annual fishing festival and a large number of species to be found.

There is good mackerel fishing in the summer and beyond, plus good shore-based sea fishing at many places along the coast such as Krogshavn, Sandvika, Jypleviktangen, Hydrostranda, Elviklandet in towards the Åbyfjord, Prisgrunn, Ivarsand, Brevikstrand and Valle.
Sildevika
In den Grenlandsfjorden gibt es sehr viele Angelmöglichkeiten. Auch die Langesundbucht hat in Bezug auf das Meeresangeln einen guten Ruf.

Während des jährlichen Fischfestivals in Langesund sind viele Fischrekorde aufgestellt worden. Hier gibt es auch eine Vielzahl von Fischarten. Den ganzen Sommer hindurch kann man Makrelen fangen. Angeln von Land aus ist vielerorts entlang der Küste möglich: in Krogshavn, Sandvika, Jypleviktangen, Hydrostranda, Elviklandet in Richtung Åbyfjord, Prisgrunn, Ivarsand, Brevikstrand und Valle.
Sildevika
Det er mange muligheter når det gjelder fiske i Grenlandsfjordene. Langesundsbukta har også et godt rykte internasjonalt når det gjelder havfiske.

Under den årlige fiskefestivalen i Langesund er det satt mange fiskerekorder. Her er det også et stort antall fiskearter. Om sommeren og utover er det godt makrellfiske. Godt sjøfiske fra land finner man mange steder langs kysten: Krogshavn, Sandvika, Jypleviktangen, Hydrostranda, Elviklandet inn mot Åbyfjorden, Prisgrunn, Ivarsand, Brevikstrand og Valle.
Sildevika
The area surrounding Grenland’s towns and villages boasts some particularly picturesque countryside. There are a number of well-signed footpaths for both long and short walks.

If you intend to follow some of these paths, it is worth contacting the tourist office in Skien for a map and perhaps also a description of the walks. Luksefjell is a popular area for walking in both summer and winter, and has signed ski trails. Pack your fishing rod and enjoy some of the fantastic fishing lakes. Don’t forget you’ll need a fishing permit; the tourist office can provide information on this.
If you’re up for a bit of a challenge, try the walk up Ulvskollen in Vestmarka. The custom is to indulge in cream cakes on your 100th trip – so you’d better get started!

paragraph.line: If you’re tempted by steep mountains and great views, Rognsåsen in Bamble offers an excellent Sunday walk for all the family. The mountain is home to beautiful flora and, if you are lucky, you may find the rare and protected fly orchid. Keep an eye on children on the steepest slopes!
An Activities Brochure detailing many great suggestions for walks is available from tourist offices in Grenland.

section.paragraph: Ibsens Venstøp
In den Gebieten außerhalb der Ortschaften in Grenland findet man eine besonders reizvolle Landschaft. Hier gibt es gut markierte Wanderwege für kurze und lange Ausflüge.

Möchten Sie den markierten Routen folgen, können Sie das Fremdenverkehrsamt in Skien um Karten und eventuell auch eine Wegbeschreibung bitten. Das Luksefjell ist im Sommer wie im Winter ein beliebtes Wandergebiet mit markierten Loipen. Nehmen Sie für die schönen, fischreichen Binnenseen gerne Ihre Angel mit, aber denken Sie daran, sich einen Angelschein zu kaufen! Informationen hierzu erhalten Sie im Fremdenverkehrsamt.

paragraph.line: Haben Sie Lust auf eine kleine Herausforderung, können Sie sich mit einer Wanderung zum Ulvskollen in der Vestmarka versuchen. Dabei ist es Brauch, auf die 100. Wanderung eine Torte mitzunehmen. Nicht gezögert – und los geht's!

Locken steile Berge und eine herrliche Aussicht, ist der Rognsåsen in Bamble der richtige Sonntagsausflug für die ganze Familie. Sie begegnen einer fantastischen Pflanzenwelt, und mit viel Glück finden Sie die seltene, unter Naturschutz stehende Fliegen-Ragwurz. Achten Sie in den steilsten Gebieten besonders auf Ihre Kinder!
In den Fremdenverkehrsämtern in Grenland haben wir für Sie eine interessante Erlebnisbroschüre mit vielen spannenden Ausflugsvorschlägen.

section.paragraph: Ibsens Venstøp

I Grenland finnes særdeles naturskjønne omgivelser. Her er godt merkede turstier for både korte og lange turer. Har man lyst til å følge merkede ruter kan man kontakte uristkontorene i Grenland for kart og beskrivelse av turen.

paragraph.line: Luksefjell har flotte turområder, sommer som vinter. Her er det merkede løyper. Ta gjerne med fiskestang da det er flotte fiskevann. Man må ha fiskekort, turistkontoret har informasjon om dette. Har man lyst til å ha en liten utfordring kan man prøve seg p† en tur opp til Ulvskollen i Vestmarka. Her er det vanlig skikk å ha med seg bløtkake på sin tur nr.100 så her er det bare å ta beina fatt. Frister bratte fjell og nydelig utsikt er Rognsåsen i Bamble en fin søndags tur for hele familien. Her er flott flora og er man heldig kan man se den sjeldne og fredede "flueblomsten". Husk: Pass på barna på det bratteste! På turistkontorene i Grenland har vi en opplevelsesbrosjyre med mange flotte turforslag.

section.paragraph: Ibsens Venstøp
